page.title: 12HOME LIFE
page.content: Carol Barton lives at Binchester, a small community just west of the A688 which passes through the SE corner of the block. The village, built using a greyish sandstone, consists mainly of two long rows of terraced streets or blocks (see slide 1). Carol lives in one of these. "My family have lived here fourteen years",she told me."My father used to work at Newtons at Auckland Park until he injured his back. He has not worked since". Carol's family now depend largely on her mothers employment in the local glove factory (worked 12yrs here).Home life can be frugal at times, but for Carol, a pleasantly happy girl,it also seems a contented one. She has friends here, the Comm. Centre Youth Club, &in summer,enjoys camping."Maybe its quiet but people say they would never move".
